lexUnit.name: hunch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a feeling or guess based on intuition.

sentence.text: I have a hunch that true life starts at the point of recognizing our failure .
` I have a hunch that there is n't a word of truth in that either , but it 's a wonderful out if you do n't want to get tied .
I had a hunch it might turn out like that .
I have a hunch Rains may try to disappear . "
Juliet had a hunch what was coming next .
On the basis of that opinion , Doctor Johnson might have backed his hunch and invested in John Pomfret .
My hunch , incidentally , is that these may not be the end of the changes .
My hunch is that this woman is his mother , and I 'm anxious to know when she 's going to show up .
Karr 's hunch had been right .
He 's not responsible for anything now , but my hunch is he knows what 's going on .
I am still rather surprised that I had the good sense for once in my life to follow my hunch and come and see you .
Shelley nodded , satisfied that her hunch could be correct .
But for the quick thinking of the two officers -- the first with his hunch about north Wales , the second with her code breaking -- we might have lost the whole team . "
I have a hunch about her -- she is definitely someone to watch for the future .
His hunch about the morals of blackmailing photographers was right .
Following his hunch about a probable escape route from the estate , one party entered the woods and followed the line of the perimeter fence to its north-eastern limit .
Mr Ishihara writes as a politician , giving his hunches rather than the fruits of real research .
I have a hunch that Hilary read him the riot act . "
When we have a hunch that somebody is telling lies , for instance , ` what we really mean is that their body language and their spoken words do not agree . "
My hunch that Sainsbury and Marks & Spencer would emerge on top proved to be bang on target .
Nursing a hunch that Kembel , avoided by all other space traffic , might be the Dalek 's base , Cory chartered Lowery 's vessel for this exploratory trip .
However , the initial hunch that Belfast , like New York City , might show innovatory patterns of front raising of this vowel turned out to be wrong .
Remembering my hunch that my drink was spiked leaves me confused .
` I also have a hunch that Raymond Burns will make an impact .
